meanings.definition: Holding firmly to a belief or opinion; stubbornly persistent.
meanings.sent1: She was pertinaciously convinced of her own abilities.
meanings.sent2: The pertinaciously loyal dog never left its owner's side.
meanings.sent3: The cat pertinaciously believed it could catch the laser pointer.
meanings.sent4: The old tree stood pertinaciously against the strong winds.
meanings.sent5: His pertinaciously positive attitude inspired those around him.

meanings.definition: Continuing firmly in a course of action despite difficulty or opposition.
meanings.sent1: The pertinaciously determined student never gave up on his dream.
meanings.sent2: She worked pertinaciously to achieve her fitness goals.
meanings.sent3: The pertinaciously optimistic chef kept trying new recipes.
meanings.sent4: The pertinaciously growing plant pushed through the rocky soil.
meanings.sent5: The team pertinaciously pursued victory until the very end.
